main event: Two witnesses spotted a ball-shaped, white object that changed to reddish in color over Thomaston, Georgia on April 24, 1966.
interesting points: The object moved slowly in a southeast direction and appeared to rotate.
The object disappeared with the coming of daylight.
Several law enforcement officers also observed the object from their respective locations.
The Air Force concluded the object was likely the planets Venus and Saturn.
A U3-A type aircraft was dispatched to investigate but found nothing.
sighted object: ball-shaped, white object that changed to reddish in color
witnesses: two civilian witnesses, several law enforcement officers
